name: Marcus Webb
role: Deuteragonist - Black market memory dealer with conscience
core_wound: Sold his dying daughter's consciousness to a wealthy client to save his own life, destroying her chance at peaceful death
wants: Redemption through revolution - wants to destroy the system that made him make that choice
needs: Self-forgiveness - to accept that some sins can't be redeemed, only moved past
voice_markers: Street slang mixed with surprising philosophical insight
Becomes poetic when discussing his daughter
contradiction: Profits from memory trade while hating himself for participating in the system

relationships.The Archivist: Suspicious of AI motivation, fears its power
relationships.Dr. Yuki Tanaka: Blames her for creating the system that corrupted him
relationships.Jin 'Ghost' Park: Mentor relationship - taught Jin the trade, feels responsible

physical_description: Late 40s, weathered appearance, extensive cheap neural implants, Undercity fashion, carries himself like someone expecting violence
background: Former military memory specialist who turned to black market after his daughter's terminal illness. Spent 15 years in the memory trade, becoming wealthy but spiritually empty. His daughter's consciousness exists somewhere in the system, possibly fragmented across multiple Composites.

character_arc.book_1: Reluctant ally to Aria, motivated by profit until he sees the scope of conspiracy
character_arc.book_2: Becomes revolutionary leader, discovers his daughter's memories in Jin (Composite), must decide whether to extract them
character_arc.book_3: Chooses not to extract daughter's memories from Jin (would destroy Jin's personality), finds peace by helping create a world where his daughter's fate can't happen again
